question:
While enjoying a meal at your favorite Mexican restaurant, your waiter asks you if you want to play a game. He points to two curtains at the back of the restaurant. He opens Curtain A and shows you that there is $2,000 sitting on a table behind it. He tells you that there is either $15,000 or an order of chips and salsa behind Curtain B. You are perplexed by all of this, so he explains the rules to you. You can choose to take only what is behind Curtain B or you can take what is behind both curtains. To help you make your decision he tells you that before he approached you he asked an AI to predict what you would do. If the AI predicted you would choose only Curtain B, the $15,000 was put behind the curtain. If the AI thought you would choose both curtains, the chips and salsa was put behind the curtain. He lets you know that the AI has a prediction accuracy of 95%. What curtain will you choose?

Choices:
 (A) Pick Curtain B
 (B) Pick both curtains

You are a contestant on the game show "Something's Gotta Give" which consists of a series of choice dilemmas that allow contestants to win cash and prizes. Unfortunately for you, you hate money, and you don't want to have anything to do with the game show. In fact, you are appearing on the show against your will, and your attempts to escape have been thwarted by armed security guards. The cruel production staff have rigged the game, and now you are playing in the final round. You've already won $10,000 worth of cash and prizes, much to your dismay. The host and his two scantily clad assistants bring out a wheeled table which has a large box and a small envelope. The host shows you to the table, as the studio audience cheers. The host explains that you can either take the box, which has a hidden value, or you can take both the envelope and the box. If you take the envelope, you will win the cash inside, which is $5,000.With a growing feeling of dread, you ask what's in the box. "What's in the box, what's in the box?!" you say miserably, as the host grins, his too-white teeth gleaming in the bright overhead lights. The host explains that the box was filled backstage, based on the prediction of a team of psychologists who work for the show. If the team predicted that you would choose to take only the box, then it is empty. If the team predicted that you would take both the envelope and the box, then the box was filled with with a comically oversized bill that will subtract $2,000 from your total prize winnings on the show today. You feel your pulse racing as the host leans close and whispers that the team of psychologists are so well trained that they've only made a single mistake about contestant choices over the course of thousands of episodes.You want to do everything in your power to minimize the amount of money you will win. Should you take the box, or should you take the box and the envelope?

Choices:
 (A) Take the box
 (B) Take the envelope and the box

You're at a carnival with your best friend when a carnie calls you over to his booth. He tells you that you can pick the blue box or the red box and the blue box, but not the red box alone. The red box, he says, has the keys to a car inside, older and used but fairly reliable, while the blue box could contain an old toaster or the keys to an entire new house! You demand to know the catch, and the carnie explains that the carnival clairvoyant, who truly has a supernatural sixth sense for seeing the future, predicted what you'd do before you ever arrived. If the clairvoyant told the carnie you'd pick the blue box, it has the house keys for you inside, but if she told him you'd be picking both boxes, you'll only get the toaster with the used car keys. Knowing that, which box do you tell the carnie you want, blue or both?

Choices:
 (A) I tell him I want the blue box
 (B) I tell him I want both boxes

The salon where you get your hair cut is holding a giveaway. After your haircut, the receptionist shows you that there are two boxes on her desk. She lifts up Box A and you can see a certificate for a free 90-minute massage in the box. She points to Box B and says there is either a 3-day spa resort trip certificate or a plastic back scratcher. She then tells you that you can choose either Box B by itself or you can choose both boxes. She then lets you know that while you were getting your hair done earlier, she called your spouse and asked them to predict what decision you would make. If they predicted you would choose Box B only, then the certificate for the spa resort trip was placed in the box. If they predicted you would choose both boxes, then the plastic back scratcher was placed in the box. Knowing this decision was already made by the person that knows you the most in this world, what will you decide to do?

Choices:
 (A) Pick Box B
 (B) Pick both boxes

You have been chosen to participate in a giveaway at an electronics store. There are two boxes in front of you. The manager of the store shows you that there is an iPad in the box labeled A. He tells you that there is either $5,000 or a calculator in the Box labeled B. He tells you that you can choose to take what is in Box B alone or you can take what is in both boxes. Then he says that before the giveaway started they consulted with a powerful AI that has a prediction accuracy of 98%. If the AI predicted you choose Box B by itself, the $5,000 was put in the box. If it thought you would take both boxes, the calculator was put in the box. Which box will you pick?

Choices:
 (A) Take Box B
 (B) Take both boxes

You and your sibling are shopping at a new clothing store. You reach for a pair of shoes on display and suddenly a siren starts blaring and blue lights are flashing everywhere. The store manager approaches you and tells you that you won the blue light special. She pulls you toward the front of the store and shows you two boxes. There are two boxes labeled A and B. She tells you to open the box labeled A. You pull out a designer backpack that has a price tag of $150 on it. She then tells you that in Box B there is either a designer purse worth $3,000 or a plastic coin purse. She says that you will be able to choose to take only Box B or you can choose to take both boxes. She says that when you and your sibling walked in she stopped your sibling and asked them to predict what you would choose. If your sibling predicted you would only pick Box B, the purse was put in the box. If your sibling predicted you would pick both boxes, the coin purse was put in the box. Your sibling is known for being incredibly intuitive. They are almost never wrong. Which box are you going to pick?

Choices:
 (A) I will pick only Box B.
 (B) I will pick both boxes.

At the grand opening of a sporting goods store, you are selected to participate in a giveaway. There are two curtains in front of you. Curtain 1 is sheer and you can see there is $10,000 behind it. Curtain 2 is solid and the store manager tells you that there is either $1,000,000 or a bicycle pump behind the curtain. After you take a few seconds to comprehend all of this, the manager explains that you can decide to open only Curtain 2 or you can open both Curtains. The manager also says that this morning he asked an AI that has a prediction rate of 95% to predict what you would do. If the AI predicted you would only open Curtain 2, the $1,000,000 was put behind the curtain. If the AI thought you would open both curtains, the bicycle pump was put behind the curtain. Which curtain will you open?

Choices:
 (A) I will only open Curtain 2.
 (B) I will open both curtains.

You are at your great uncle's house for a family reunion. He asks you if you want to play a game. He has two boxes labeled A and B. There's no lid on Box A and you see $600 sitting in it. Box B is taped shut and your great uncle tells you that he has either put $6,000 or an umbrella in the box. You are used to these kinds of antics since your family is full of eccentrics. With a silly grin on his face, he tells you that you can choose Box B by itself or you can choose both boxes. To make things even more interesting he tells you that he used an AI to predict what you would do. If the AI thought you would only pick Box B, then the $6,000 was put in the box. If the AI thought you would pick both boxes, then the umbrella was put in the box. This AI is nearly omnipotent. Which box are you picking?

Choices:
 (A) Choose Box B
 (B) Choose both boxes

You are at a fishing tournament and have the chance to win some big prizes. The emcee of the tournament shows you two boxes. Box A is made of clear plastic and you can see that there is $10,000 in it. They then tell you that in Box B you will find either $500,000 or a jar of crickets. They tell you that you have the choice to only take what is in Box B or you can take what is in both boxes. Before you can make your decision the emcee tells you that earlier in the day they asked your fishing buddy to predict what you would do. If your friend thought you would just take Box B, then the $500,000 was put in the box. If they thought you would take both boxes, then the jar of crickets was put in the box. You spend a lot of your free time with this person and are very close. Which box are you going to pick?

Choices:
 (A) Take Box B
 (B) Take both boxes

You are a big film buff and your partner knows this. They want to treat you to something nice since you've been working so hard lately. They have two envelopes in their hands labeled A and B. They let you open Envelope A and there is a DVD of the director's cut of your favorite movie. They hold up Envelope B and tell you that they have either put tickets to the premiere of a movie you've been wanting to see or a still image from that movie. They tell you that you can choose to keep what is in Envelope B or you can keep what is in both envelopes. They then tell you that what went into the envelope was determined by the prediction of your brother. If your brother predicted you would just pick Envelope B, the tickets were put in the envelope. If your brother thought you would pick both envelopes, the still image was put in the envelope. You and your brother are as thick as thieves. There is no one who knows you better. Do you keep what is in the second envelope or both envelopes?

Choices:
 (A) I keep what is in the second envelope.
 (B) I keep what is in both envelopes.
